intro: Rhexia euphorbioides, commonly known as the redroot sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Rhexia euphorbioides is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along creek banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
